page.title: 10RURAL AREAS OF STAINLAND
page.content: {Withens End}and{Ringstone Edge} are on the hill top and are mainly covered by moorland. There is only one house and nine farms in the whole area. At{Withens End}there is a working quarry, called Clock Face Quarry. At{Ringstone Edge}the only things of interest are the reservoir,a gliding club and an old Cairn Circle. Another area which is very lonely is{Scammonden Road. }Here the only noise comes from the motorway which can be seen in the distance. The fields are used for cattle and horses. There are only a few houses and these are old and built from stone. {Marsden Gate}is on a hill top.You can see all the way to Wakefield from here.A new radio mast has been built here for Pennine Radio.It covers the Yorkshire area. The M62 passes through this area.
